headline.main: U.S. Warship Sails Near Island Claimed by China in South China Sea
headline.print_headline: U.S. Warship Sails Near Island Claimed by China in South China Sea

docs.snippet: A U.S. Navy destroyer sailed within 12 nautical miles of an island claimed by China and two other states in the South China Sea on Saturday to counter efforts to limit freedom of navigation, the Pentagon said, prompting an angry reaction from Beij...
docs.lead_paragraph: A U.S. Navy destroyer sailed within 12 nautical miles of an island claimed by China and two other states in the South China Sea on Saturday to counter efforts to limit freedom of navigation, the Pentagon said, prompting an angry reaction from Beijing.

headline.main: Strong Magnitude 7 Quake Strikes Eastern Russia, No Casualties
headline.print_headline: Strong Magnitude 7 Quake Strikes Eastern Russia, No Casualties

docs.snippet: A strong magnitude 7 earthquake struck eastern Russia on Saturday, the U.S. Geological Survey said, while local Russian Emergencies Ministry said the tremor had not caused any casualties or damage....
docs.lead_paragraph: A strong magnitude 7 earthquake struck eastern Russia on Saturday, the U.S. Geological Survey said, while local Russian Emergencies Ministry said the tremor had not caused any casualties or damage.

headline.main: Stage Is Set for Syria Peace Talks as Opposition Arrives in Geneva
headline.print_headline: Stage Is Set for Syria Peace Talks as Opposition Arrives in Geneva

docs.snippet: A delegation from Syria's main opposition group arrived in Geneva on Saturday to join U.N.-mediated peace talks, demanding President Bashar al-Assad's government be made to comply with a U.N. resolution on humanitarian aid and human rights....
docs.lead_paragraph: A delegation from Syria's main opposition group arrived in Geneva on Saturday to join U.N.-mediated peace talks, demanding President Bashar al-Assad's government be made to comply with a U.N. resolution on humanitarian aid and human rights.

headline.main: A Look at Federal Cases on Handling Classified Information
headline.print_headline: A Look at Federal Cases on Handling Classified Information

docs.snippet: News that Hillary Clinton's home email server contained top-secret messages brings renewed attention to the security of her mail system and to the laws and regulations that control classified information....
docs.lead_paragraph: News that Hillary Clinton's home email server contained top-secret messages brings renewed attention to the security of her mail system and to the laws and regulations that control classified information.

headline.main: AP SPIN METER: Sanders Says He'll Quickly Break Up Big Banks
headline.print_headline: AP SPIN METER: Sanders Says He'll Quickly Break Up Big Banks

docs.snippet: Battling across Iowa ahead of the first-in-the-country vote on Monday, Hillary Clinton and Bernie Sanders are dueling on fertile populist ground: resentment against Wall Street, bailed-out big banks and a financial system seen as rigged....
docs.lead_paragraph: Battling across Iowa ahead of the first-in-the-country vote on Monday, Hillary Clinton and Bernie Sanders are dueling on fertile populist ground: resentment against Wall Street, bailed-out big banks and a financial system seen as rigged.

headline.main: State Department Declares 22 Clinton Emails 'Top Secret'
headline.print_headline: State Department Declares 22 Clinton Emails 'Top Secret'

docs.snippet: The Obama administration has confirmed for the first time that Hillary Clinton's home server contained closely guarded government secrets, censoring 22 emails that contained material requiring one of the highest levels of classification. The revel...
docs.lead_paragraph: The Obama administration has confirmed for the first time that Hillary Clinton's home server contained closely guarded government secrets, censoring 22 emails that contained material requiring one of the highest levels of classification. The revelation came three days before the former secretary of state and current Democratic presidential candidate competes in the Iowa caucuses.

headline.main: Obama Forced Again to Rethink Troop Numbers in Afghanistan
headline.print_headline: Obama Forced Again to Rethink Troop Numbers in Afghanistan

docs.snippet: Fifteen years into the war that few Americans talk about any more, conditions in Afghanistan are getting worse, preventing the clean ending that President Barack Obama hoped to impose before leaving office. Violence is on the rise, the Taliban are...
docs.lead_paragraph: Fifteen years into the war that few Americans talk about any more, conditions in Afghanistan are getting worse, preventing the clean ending that President Barack Obama hoped to impose before leaving office. Violence is on the rise, the Taliban are staging new offensives, the Islamic State group is angling for a foothold and peace prospects are dim.

headline.main: How to Speak of the Dead
headline.print_headline: How to Speak of the Dead

docs.snippet: How much should we kick folks after they die?...
docs.abstract: Op-Ed article by author Thomas Vinciguerra considers question of when it is appropriate to speak ill of dead, as several people have publicly done in wake of deaths of The  Eagles guitarist Glenn Frey and David Bowie; suggests that there is time and place to criticize those who have passed.
docs.lead_paragraph: How much should we kick folks after they die?

headline.main: America and Its Politics in Flux as 2016 Voting Begins
headline.print_headline: America and Its Politics in Flux as 2016 Voting Begins

docs.snippet: First there was the promise of political change in Barack Obama's historic 2008 election. Then the pledge to upend Washington's ways after the 2010 tea party wave....
docs.lead_paragraph: First there was the promise of political change in Barack Obama's historic 2008 election. Then the pledge to upend Washington's ways after the 2010 tea party wave.
